info.question: Provides the Skip-gram and continuous bag-of-words (CBOW) training architectures
______s implementation of the supervised multi-class, multi-label text classification algorithm extends the fastText text classifier to use GPU acceleration with custom CUDA kernels.

With ______ you can train a model on more than a billion words in a couple of minutes using a multi-core CPU or a GPU. And, you achieve performance on par with the state-of-the-art deep learning text classification algorithms.
______ provides accelerated training of the fastText text classifier on multi-core CPUs or a GPU and Word2Vec on GPUs using highly optimized CUDA kernels.

______ provides enriched Word Vectors with Subword Information by learning vector representations for character n-grams. This approach enables BlazingText to generate meaningful vectors for out-of-vocabulary (OOV) words by representing their vectors as the sum of the character n-gram (subword) vectors.
______ provides a batch_skipgram mode for the Word2Vec algorithm that allows faster training and distributed computation across multiple CPU nodes.

______  expects a single preprocessed text file with space-separated tokens. Each line in the file should contain a single sentence. If you need to train on multiple text files, concatenate them into one file and upload the file in the respective channel.
You have time series groupings for demand for different products, server loads, and requests for webpages. ______  trains a single model jointly over all of the time series
When your dataset contains hundreds of related time series, ______ outperforms the standard ARIMA and ETS methods.
With the ______ algorithm, you can also use the trained model to generate forecasts for new time series that are similar to the ones it has been trained on.
The training input for the ______ algorithm is one or, preferably, more target time series that have been generated by the same process or similar processes.
Based on an input dataset, the ______ algorithm trains a model that learns an approximation of this process/processes and uses it to predict how the target time series evolves.

With the ______ algorithm, each target time series can be optionally associated with a vector of static (time-independent) categorical features provided by the cat field and a vector of dynamic (time-dependent) time series provided by the dynamic_feat field.
SageMaker trains the ______ model by randomly sampling training examples from each target time series in the training dataset.
With the ______ algorithm, each training example consists of a pair of adjacent context and prediction windows with fixed predefined lengths.
With the ______ algorithm, to control how far in the past the network can see, use the context_length hyperparameter.
With the ______ algorithm, to control how far in the future predictions can be made, use the prediction_length hyperparameter.
In a click prediction system, the ______ model can capture click rate patterns observed when ads from a certain ad-category are placed on pages from a certain page-category.
The ______ algorithm is a good choice for tasks dealing with high dimensional sparse datasets, such as click prediction and item recommendation.
The SageMaker implementation of ______ considers only pair-wise (2nd order) interactions between features.
For training, the ______ algorithm currently supports only the recordIO-protobuf format with Float32 tensors. Because their use case is predominantly on sparse data, CSV is not a good candidate.
______ uses a convolutional neural network (ResNet) that can be trained from scratch or trained using transfer learning when a large number of training images are not available.

The ______ algorithm supports both RecordIO (application/x-recordio) and image (image/png, image/jpeg, and application/x-image) content types for training in file mode and supports RecordIO (application/x-recordio) content type for training in pipe mode.

With the ______ algorithm, you can also train in pipe mode using the image files (image/png, image/jpeg, and application/x-image), without creating RecordIO files, by using the augmented manifest format.

With the ______ algorithm, distributed training is currently not supported in pipe mode and can only be used in file mode. The algorithm supports image/png, image/jpeg, and application/x-image for inference.
The ______ algorithm is designed to capture associations between IPv4 addresses and various entities, such as user IDs or account numbers.
You can use the ______ algorithm to identify a user attempting to log into a web service from an anomalous IP address.
You can use the ______ algorithm to identify an account that is attempting to create computing resources from an unusual IP address.
The ______ algorithm ingests historical data as (entity, IPv4 Address) pairs and learns the IP usage patterns of each entity.
When queried with an (entity, IPv4 Address) event, a(n) ______ model returns a score that infers how anomalous the pattern of the event is.
When a user attempts to log in from an IP address, if the ______ algorithm inference request score is high enough, a web login server might decide to trigger a multi-factor authentication system.
The ______ algorithm can also learn vector representations of IP addresses, known as embeddings.
With the ______ algorithm, you can use vector-encoded embeddings as features in downstream machine learning tasks that use the information observed in the IP addresses.
You can use the ______ algorithm in tasks such as measuring similarities between IP addresses in clustering and visualization tasks.
With the ______ algorithm, you define the attributes that you want the algorithm to use to determine similarity.

The ______ algorithm expects tabular data, where rows represent the observations that you want to cluster, and the columns represent attributes of the observations. The n attributes in each row represent a point in n-dimensional space. The Euclidean distance between these points represents the similarity of the corresponding observations.
The ______ algorithm groups observations with similar attribute values (the points corresponding to these observations are closer together).

Training with the ______ algorithm has three steps: sampling, dimension reduction, and index building. Sampling reduces the size of the initial dataset so that it fits into memory. For dimension reduction, the algorithm decreases the feature dimension of the data to reduce the footprint of the ______ model in memory and inference latency.

SageMaker provides two dimension reduction methods: random projection and the fast Johnson-Lindenstrauss transform. Typically, you use dimension reduction for high-dimensional (d >1000) datasets to avoid the curse of dimensionality that troubles the statistical analysis of data that becomes sparse as dimensionality increases.

The main objective of the ______ algorithm training is to construct the index. The index enables efficient lookups of distances between points whose values or class labels have not yet been determined and the k nearest points to use for inference.
The ______ algorithm is most commonly used to discover a user-specified number of topics shared by documents within a text corpus.
With the ______ algorithm, each observation is a document, the features are the presence (or occurrence count) of each word, and the categories are the topics.
Since the method used by the ______ algorithm is unsupervised, the topics are not specified up front, and are not guaranteed to align with how a human may naturally categorize documents.
With the ______ algorithm, the topics are learned as a probability distribution over the words that occur in each document. Each document, in turn, is described as a mixture of topics.

The exact content of two documents with similar topic mixtures will not be the same. But overall, you would expect these documents to more frequently use a shared subset of words, than when compared with a document from a different topic mixture. This allows the ______ algorithm to discover these word groups and use them to form topics.
The ______ algorithm learns a linear function, or, for classification problems, a linear threshold function, and maps a vector x to an approximation of the label y.

With the ______ algorithm, you can also explore a large number of models and choose the best. The best model optimizes either of the following: Continuous objectives, such as mean square error, cross entropy loss, absolute error; or Discrete objectives suited for classification, such as F1 measure, precision, recall, or accuracy.
With the ______ algorithm, Documents that contain frequent occurrences of words such as bike, car, train, mileage, and speed are likely to share a topic on transportation for example.
The ______ algorithm can be used to classify or summarize documents based on the topics detected or to retrieve information or recommend content based on topic similarities.
The topics from documents that the ______ algorithm learns are characterized as a latent representation because the topics are inferred from the observed word distributions in the corpus.
With the ______ algorithm, the semantics of topics are usually inferred by examining the top ranking words they contain.

With the ______ algorithm, because the method is unsupervised, only the number of topics, not the topics themselves, are prespecified. In addition, the topics are not guaranteed to align with how a human might naturally categorize documents.
With the ______ algorithm, topic modeling provides a way to visualize the contents of a large document corpus in terms of the learned topics.
With the ______ algorithm, documents relevant to each topic might be indexed or searched for based on their soft topic labels.
With the ______ algorithm, the latent representations of documents might also be used to find similar documents in the topic space.
You can also use the latent representations of documents that the ______ algorithm learns for input to another supervised algorithm such as a document classifier.

Because the latent representations of documents are expected to capture the semantics of the underlying documents, algorithms based in part on these representations, like the ______ algorithm, are expected to perform better than those based on lexical features alone.
With the ______ algorithm, the embeddings are learned in a way that preserves the semantics of the relationship between pairs of objects in the original space in the embedding space.
With the ______ algorithm, you can use the learned embeddings to efficiently compute nearest neighbors of objects and to visualize natural clusters of related objects in low-dimensional space
With the ______ algorithm, you can also use the embeddings as features of the corresponding objects in downstream supervised tasks, such as classification or regression.
The ______ algorithm generalizes the well-known Word2Vec embedding technique for words that is optimized in the SageMaker BlazingText Algorithm.
With the ______ algorithm, the object is categorized into one of the classes in a specified collection with a confidence score that it belongs to the class.
With the ______ algorithm, an objetcs location and scale in the image are indicated by a rectangular bounding box.
The ______ algorithm uses the Single Shot multibox Detector (SSD) framework and supports two base networks: VGG and ResNet
With the ______ algorithm, the network can be trained from scratch, or trained with models that have been pre-trained on the ImageNet dataset.
The ______ algorithm finds a new set of features called components, which are composites of the original features that are uncorrelated with one another.

The ______ algorithm operates in two modes, depending on the scenario: regular for datasets with sparse data and a moderate number of observations and features; randomized for datasets with both a large number of observations and features, this mode uses an approximation algorithm.
With the ______ algorithm, the rows represent observations you want to embed in a lower dimensional space. The columns represent features that you want to find a reduced approximation for.

The ______ algorithm calculates the covariance matrix (or an approximation thereof in a distributed manner), and then performs the singular value decomposition on this summary to produce the ______ components.
With each data point, the ______ algorithm associates an anomaly score.

With each data point, the ______ algorithm associates an anomaly score. Low score values indicate that the data point is considered normal. High values indicate the presence of an anomaly in the data.

With the ______ algorithm, the definitions of low and high depend on the application but common practice suggests that scores beyond three standard deviations from the mean score are considered anomalous.

While there are many applications of anomaly detection algorithms to one-dimensional time series data such as traffic volume analysis or sound volume spike detection, the ______ algorithm is designed to work with arbitrary-dimensional input.
The ______ algorithm scales well with respect to number of features, data set size, and number of instances.
The ______ algorithm tags every pixel in an image with a class label from a predefined set of classes.

With the ______ algorithm, tagging is fundamental for understanding scenes, which is critical to an increasing number of computer vision applications, such as self-driving vehicles, medical imaging diagnostics, and robot sensing.
Because the ______ algorithm classifies every pixel in an image, it also provides information about the shapes of the objects contained in the image.

With the ______ algorithm, the segmentation output is represented as an RGB or grayscale image, called a segmentation mask. A segmentation mask is an RGB (or grayscale) image with the same shape as the input image.

The ______ algorithm is built using the MXNet Gluon framework and the Gluon CV toolkit provides you with a choice of three built-in algorithms to train a deep neural network. You can use the Fully-Convolutional Network (FCN) algorithm , Pyramid Scene Parsing (PSP) algorithm, or DeepLabV3.

Example applications of the ______ algorithm include: machine translation (input a sentence from one language and predict what that sentence would be in another language), text summarization (input a longer string of words and predict a shorter string of words that is a summary), speech-to-text (audio clips converted into output sentences in tokens).
The ______ algorithm uses Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) and Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) models with attention as encoder-decoder architectures.

The ______ algorithm has done remarkably well in machine learning competitions because it robustly handles a variety of data types, relationships, and distributions, and because of the large number of hyperparameters that can be tweaked and tuned for improved fits. This flexibility makes the ______ algorithm a solid choice for problems in regression, classification (binary and multiclass), and ranking.
